summary: Very simple and easy to use

description:
One star lost per flaw. The first is the error "Could not start recording, already an active recording using org.gnome.Shell.Screencast?" when trying to record .mp4 files. This is apparently a known issue, so whatever.

The second is that if you move the recording window while recording, the recording stops and does not appear to be saved. Only lost about 10 minutes of work, but still should not happen.

Looks simple to use, except that I wanted to record a window area that didn't match the size of Peek's window. It seems that it was possible to change the width of the recorded area, but only by dragging an edge that was exactly 1 pixel wide. I didn't manage to change the height, no matter how many times I tried moving the cursor over the bottom edge to grab and drag it. I never even saw the cursor change to the drag handle. Gave up and installed something else.
summary: Very difficult to change recorded area size

description:
Check out this comment: https://github.com/phw/peek/issues/461#issuecomment-508350562

The flatpak version crashes with: "free(): double free detected in tcache 2"

If you run via `flatpak run com.uploadedlobster.peek` it will still notify you that the file is saved under `~/.var/app/com.uploadedlobster.peek/cache/peek/`.
It looks nice and simple, but needs some update cuz it is crashing :>>
As of 31-10-2019 this still crashes when trying to save a gif on ubuntu 19.04. Pitty, since it's such a super easy to use program

Works great - if it crashes for you after recording, it's because you have and old version without the bugfix. New version .deb at http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian/pool/main/p/peek/peek_1.3.1-6~bpo9+1_amd64.deb
cant click through window, but everything else works. this should NOT be your only screen recorder. this is for demonstrating functionality of a UI and quickly making a gif out of it.

description: I love the idea, but the FPS is absolute garbage for me, which is weird given that I can record 60fps with OBS just fine. If I wanted 5fps I'd stake a screenshot!

I've already used Peek for a while in other distributions, it still works wonderfully, and records videos very well on Wayland. It's not perfect, its window can be a little distracting, and it can't really record the whole screen, but it does what it's meant to.
Easy to use application to create animated gifs or videos from part of your screen.
Totally fine. i like it
I am surprised how quick and easy this tool is to use. Fantastic!
Works as expected, intuitive design, great app

This gets a lot of bad reviews, but it works perfectly fine!

The problem is, this isn't getting updated in Software for Ubuntu for some reason - it's at least 3 releases behind.

Go get the latest version here:

https://github.com/phw/peek#ubuntu

Ubuntu 19.10 64 bit
Worked perfectly! Nice app. Did what I needed

This is a great little utility that does exactly what it says on the tin. Simply resize the window to your liking, hit record (ctrl+alt+r by default, or just press the button), do your thing, , stop the recording and and BAM, you've got your GIF.

description: Einfache Bedienung, aber es hat den Anschein, dass es die Tastenkombinationen für den Emacs abfängt. Damit kann ich keine Emacs-Edits mit M-x, C-x und dergleichen aufnehmen.
Leider keine Audioaufnahme

Das Fenster positioniert sich beim ersten Aufruf fast transparent oben Links. Da mein Hauptmonitor rechts und etwas verschoben ist, war die Menüleiste nicht sichtbar. Ich habe es erst nicht gesehen und daher mehrfach gestartet. 
Anschliessend konnte ich die Anwendung nicht starten, da die Meldung erschien, dass eine andere Anwendung das Screen recording nutzt - wegen mehrfachem starten. 
Habe das problem dann mit {killall peek} gelöst - da war wohl noch ein hängender Prozess.

Die Aufnahme war super. Es fehlt nur noch eine einfache möglichkeit das Video zu schneiden. Ich muss den Anfang, das Ende und ein Stück in der Mitte kürzen. Gif animationen zur Problembeschreibung in Bugreports müssen nunmal einfach und schnell sein.
summary: Onboarding des tools schlecht, sonst gut

description: Warum kein Ton? Es könnte ganz brauchbar sein aber Film ohne Ton ist seit 1920 nicht mehr üblich.

description: Me resultaba bastante útil pero ahora mismo no funciona. El sistema es Fedora 34 (Gnome y Wayland con ATI)

Sale el mensaje:
Recording backend unavailable
Unable to initialize default recording backend: Peek requires FFmpeg or running GNOME Shell session.

Instalé FFmpeg, inicialicé Gnome Shell Session y nada, sale el mismo mensaje.

De herramientas para grabar un gif de tu pantalla existen muchas. Pero esta es la mejor: Rápida, simple, sencilla y sobre todo libre.
Viene con la opción para grabar APNG, WebM y MP4. Sinceramente, solo la uso para GIF. Para grabar una pantalla y hacer un video, hay herramientas específicas.
En Ubuntu 20.04 funciona perfecto. No así en Ubuntu Mate 20.04, pero seguramente sea por falta de alguna librería o algo de eso.
Recomendada.
summary: Rápida herramienta para gif de pantalla

description: Práctica y fácil de usar, permite seleccionar la zona a grabar, me dió error al intentar guardar GIF pero el video en formato .MP4 sale de muy buena calidad.

Muy buena aplicación, es práctica para cuando te solicitan una demo y clips sencillos donde utilizar una aplicación avanzada de video sería demasiado problemática. Peek te permite hacerlo rápidamente.
summary: Una aplicación muy práctica para crear videos cortos

Je m'en sers pour faire des GIF sur comment utiliser nos logiciels en helpdesk. Ca marche, ça marche vite, et ça marche bien
